meanings.sent1: The teacher dismissed the student's balderdash during class.
meanings.sent2: I can't believe you fell for such balderdash!
meanings.sent3: The comedian's balderdash had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were just a pile of balderdash.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was full of balderdash and empty promises.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his balderdash; he's just trying to confuse you.
meanings.sent2: She rolled her eyes at his constant balderdash.
meanings.sent3: The children's game was filled with playful balderdash.
meanings.sent4: His idea of jumping off a cliff was pure balderdash.
meanings.sent5: The conspiracy theories were nothing but balderdash.
